Steps.Message: Good morning, this is a message from Harry at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut that is currently in progress today the 21st January 2026 in the CT15 postcode area. It was just to let you know that our customer support vehicle is on site and is located outside number 7 Short Lane where they will provide free hot drinks, charging points, Wi-Fi and face-to-face support. Please feel free to visit Dionne from our welfare team if you require any assistance whilst the power is off. Our reference number for this is INCD-326818-U. If you have any questions or you have moved from the CT15 postcode area, then please give us a call on 105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 09:00. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We are carrying out these works to connect a new property to the network. This work is following on from a customer request. Due to the type of electricity cables we need to make the connection to our engineers will need to temporarily switch off your power to ensure they can carry out this work safely. This work will adhere to the customer request, ensure that our network can uphold the electricity usage in your area and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut. We appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months and we apologise for this. This work is taking place in the Short Lane and Glebelands area.

This work is taking place in the Brandon Fields.

If you have any questions or you have moved from the CB6 postcode area, then please call 105. Thank you. VB & SMS sent.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Hill Row in Haddenham.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of trees near our overhead cables. This has identified trees that have grown close, which could damage the cables and affect your electricity supply. Our contractors need to temporarily switch off your power so we can safely cut the trees away from the cables. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place in two location adjacent to Paythorne Farm off Edburton Road. What3Words loaction /// passing.confronts.online.

This will also reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut. This work is taking place in the Turners Hill Road area.

Sent by Simon at 14:56 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers cut away a fault on the underground network in the Joseph Powell Close area, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. There are now only 3 properties without power, who we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent at 14:18 by Simon - More electricity has been diverted thanks to our ground team's continued work, restoring power to further properties.

We know that some properties are still without electricity. If this is the case at your property, don't worry; I'll still keep you informed.

If your electricity has come back on now, or does so at any time in the future, simply click this link to stop receiving our SMS updates: bit.ly/348KOZ3.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 01:04 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Duke Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground cable fault, which our engineers repaired.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 00:17 - Hello again. Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut, I know the lights being off is a worry.

Our staff have advised that that the repair work is proving to be more complex than previously anticipated and as a result, we may need to turn off more power to enable safe repairs. Due to the delay this has caused, they've advised a new time of 01:00-02:00 to have your power back on.

I know another delay is frustrating; our engineers always try to give us the best estimate that they can but due to the safety elements of working with live electricity, sometimes they have to adjust their repairs at short notice.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: Following an unplanned power cut on the 12th of January 2026 caused by some faulty equipment within our substation, we are transferring the service cables that supply your electricity to the newly installed equipment. To ensure our engineers can carry out this work safely we will need to switch off your power. Once completed, these works will enable the generator to be disconnected to restore our network to normal running conditions, improve the reliability of your power and will reduce the risk of you having a unplanned power cut in the future. To provide additional support to affected customers, we will have a customer champion on site for face to face support and battery packs to power some equipment such as charging mobile phones if needed. This work is taking place within our substation on Roscoe Street.

MainMessage: The electricity supply to your premises may currently be affected by planned work.  You should have received a letter explaining this.  We hope to be able to restore your supplies by 21-JAN-2026 15:00.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this is causing.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 03:56 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers diverted power around the underground network fault in the Stroud Green Road area, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. There are now only 2 properties without power, who we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry we've not been able to restore your power yet. We appreciate it can be unsettling to have a power cut during the night, but our engineers work 24 hours on issues like this so we're still aiming to have power restored as soon as possible.

If you light candles, please be mindful of them and take extra care when using the stairs. If you have any concerns, please call us on 105 and our team will help. We'll keep you updated. Sent by Aaron at 01:52
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 00:25 - Thanks for your patience over tonight.

Our engineers have let us know our digging team have begun to excavate, to expose the cabling for repairs. To give them time to do this safely, the estimated time frame to restore your power is now between 02:30 and 03:30.

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 03:14 - We can now confirm that all power in the Chittock Mead area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground network fault. Our engineers have managed to restore power, but there is still further work required to fix the fault.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has now been off for several hours and we're working as quickly as possible to get you back on. Our staff have advised we will need to visit some properties individually to carry out safety tests before we can restore power. 

If you need to get in touch with us, please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 01:34 - Thanks for bearing with us over tonight. Our team of cable jointers have now identified the suspected section of faulted underground cabling using their specialist equipment.

Our digging team will now begin excavations, and this can take some time depending on the surface material, and how much space is needed to allow our engineers to assess the fault and make their repairs safely. 

Our estimated time frame of 04:00 and 05:00 doesn't need to change currently. We'll continue to keep you updated, but our team are always here if you have any questions.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 03:45 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 50 customers in the KT22 8 area, by making repairs to the damaged underground cable that was caused by another company. We know your power may have been off for a long time, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We know the time frame we initially estimated is now approaching. Our engineers are continuing their work to repair our network in the KT22 8 area.

As our staff are working with live electricity, we need to wait until it is safe for them to stop and contact us with an update.

We're sorry you've been impacted by this, and we'll provide you an update as soon as possible. Sent by Bev at 02:48.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Is your power back on? We keep texting those signed up, and will continue to until the final 27 customers are restored. Want to stop receiving text updates? You will need to visit our website here - https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Thank you.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 03:05 - We can confirm that all power in the Shortmead Drive area should be back on.

The issue was due to an underground cable being struck by a third party, which initially caused our substation equipment to operate for safety. Our engineers have now been able to make repairs tot he damage after work had to be temporarily halted due to a gas leak.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on. If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have advised that they are estimating to have all supplies back on between 03:30 and 04:30. We appreciate it can be unsettling to have a power cut during the night, but our engineers work 24 hours on issues like this so we'll have your power restored as soon as possible.

If you light candles, please be mindful of them and take extra care when using the stairs. If you have any concerns, please call us on 105 and our team will help. We'll keep you updated. Sent by Bev at 02:11

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 23:22 - We can now confirm that all power in the Hartington Road area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Hartington Road area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 08:52 - We can now confirm that all power in the Devons Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 08:13 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Engineers have arrived on site to investigate what we believe to be an issue at the local substation in the Devons Road area. Using an average timescale for this type of issue, we're looking to have you back on between 11:00 and 12:00, however we must stress that this time may change, depending on what our staff find. We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress, but for more information about this type of fault; here's a short YouTube video https://bit.ly/2y8Dtfz. Sent by Theo at 07:51.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 10:35 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers diverted power around a fault on the overhead network in the Haywards Heath area, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. There are now only 2 properties without power, who we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 10:04 - We've liaised with our engineers, and they have advised that they are in the process of patrolling our overhead cabling and checking the network for any visible problems. As they do this, they will identify healthy sections of cable which we can attempt to use to divert power around the fault.

To give them time to complete their investigations safely, we're now estimating we'll have the power back on between 12:30 and 13:30. I'm sorry that we've had to change the time frame. However, I will personally be keeping an eye on this, and I'll continue to update you with further news.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We know the time frame we initially estimated is now approaching. Our engineers are continuing their work to locate a fault on our overhead network in the Haywards Heath area.

As our staff are working with live electricity, we need to wait until it is safe for them to stop and contact us with an update.

We're sorry you've been impacted by this, and we'll provide you an update as soon as possible. Sent by Simon at 09:40.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

If in the area, please take care and stay at least 10m away from the cable. 

Based on an average for this kind of issue, our estimated time to have you back on is between 13:30 and 14:30. 

We'll keep you updated with our progress, but in the meantime our team are always here to talk on 105 if you have any questions or concerns.

We'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.

Sent by Simon at 10:57 - We're very sorry we've had to switch off your electricity. Our engineers have turned off the power in the Brickyard Lane  area in the interest of the public's health and safety. This is so they can carry out repairs to an overhead cable that is on the ground.

If in the area, please take care and stay at least 10m away from the cable. 

Based on an average for this kind of issue, our estimated time to have you back on is between 13:30 and 14:30. 

We'll keep you updated with our progress, but in the meantime our team are always here to talk on 105 if you have any questions or concerns.

PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by 11kV OH Fault affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 21-JAN-2026 13:30.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 09:23 - We can now confirm that all power in the Hornsey Road area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
I appreciate your continued patience this morning. I know having power cuts as often as this must be very disruptive, and our staff are doing everything they can to get this resolved.

They are still testing our network in the area, and depending on the local infrastructure this can take some time. However, once they update us we'll know if our estimated time frame needs to change and why, and I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

In the meantime, if we can offer any support or advice, our team are always available to talk on 105.

Sent by Theo at 08:20.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Hornsey Road area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by Simon at 08:19
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have now arrived on site in the Thornton Road area.

As any issues that currently exist on our network have affected our equipment at the substation, engineers will start their testing there. They will then check our network equipment throughout the area to try and identify any problems, before trying to restore power.

Our estimated time frame of 11:00-12:00 hasn't changed, but if this is not successful it's possible that a cable repair may be needed. This can involve ground excavations, traffic management equipment or specialist teams. As soon as our staff can safely update us, we'll give you the latest news. Sent by Simon at 08:07.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 11:11 - Thanks for your patience today. Our engineers have now investigated the low hanging overhead cables, and have deemed it safe to restore power back to all 1081 properties in the King's Lynn PE32 area.

We're very sorry we had to turn your power off unexpectedly, and with so little warning. We usually provide much more notice if we can, but in a situation like this our first priority is the safety of the public and our staff.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. If your power is still off or if you have any questions, call our team on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Roland at 10:48 - Hi - thanks for bearing with us, I know a power cut can be very disruptive. We've had an update from our staff that there are now 5 properties still affected by the emergency isolation, as they have managed to safely divert some power, getting the lights back on for 826 of our customers. We'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

We have been alerted to a potentially dangerous situation involving a low hanging overhead cable, so have responded as quickly as possible and asked our control room to turn power off to the area using our high voltage network. This is why a wide area has lost electricity.

Once further specialist field staff have assessed the situation, we'll start diverting power back to affected homes as soon as they advise us it's safe. You may notice your lights going on and off as we work to get as much power restored as we can.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 09:55 - We're very sorry we've had to switch off your electricity. Our engineers have turned off the power in the King's Lynn PE32 area in the interest of the public's health and safety. This is so they can investigate reports of a low overhead line. We initially turned the power off to 1081 properties, however, we've managed to remotely divert power around the fault and get 250 of those properties back on.

If in the area, please take care and stay at least 10m away from the cable. 

Our engineers are estimating to have the power back on between 11:00 and 12:00, however, this may change. We'll keep you updated with our progress, but in the meantime our team are always here to talk on 105 if you have any questions or concerns.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 09:40. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Name: Power back on

Steps.Message:
Hello, Roland from the messaging team here. Thanks for your patience today, our field staff and control room engineers are working to get your power back on as quickly as they can.

Our records show that some properties affected by today's power cut may have had other unexpected interruptions recently. If you have, we're sorry for further disruption. All power cuts are fully investigated by our engineers but can sometimes happen multiple times before we can safely find the issue and fix it.

We know that not everyone affected by today's power cut will have had other power cuts recently, but we want you to know that if you have, our customer services team will try to update as many customers as possible about our investigations.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Roland at 10:30 - Hi - thanks for bearing with us, I know a power cut can be very disruptive. We've had an update from our staff that there are now 20 properties still affected by the faulty underground cable, as they have managed to safely divert some power, getting the lights back on for 415 of our customers. We'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the Waltham Abbey EN9 area to investigate the power cut affecting 435 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Roland at 10:19.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Roland at 10:00 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is a fault on our underground cables that initially interrupted power to 1409 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 435 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 12:30 and 13:30, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 11:13 - Our engineers have completed their investigation and have found the power is off due to a temporary generator which has stopped working.

We're sorry for the disruption this power cut will be causing, especially the impact it will be having on the start to your day. If you have any concerns about this please do not hesitate to contact our Customer Services team any time.

We will work to fix the problem as quickly and safely as possible.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Hastings Close area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Sent by Roland at 10:38.
